conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hey, how are you doing, have you ever heard of a charity called Save the Children?
Persuadee (EE): No I havent.
Persuadee (EE): What is it about?
Persuader (ER): It's an international organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries, does that sound like something you'd get behind?
Persuadee (EE): No thank you.
Persuader (ER): May I ask why?
Persuader (ER): Your help could really make a difference in a child's life, think of a child who didn't have enough to eat, just a small bit of help may have saved them, are you sure you're not interested?
Persuadee (EE): I am already making a difference in many children lives.
Persuader (ER): That's great, it sounds like it's an issue you really care about then, why not put some of that effort into a charity that's doing really great work like Save the Children?
Persuadee (EE): I have donated 15 years of my life to charity
Persuader (ER): I'm not asking you to donate years of your life, just a couple of cents if possible, is that something you could possibly do tonight?
Persuadee (EE): No thank you
Persuader (ER): You're probably on a computer right now, so you probably have quite a bit of money yourself, don't you think you could spare maybe 25 cents for some needy children around the world?
Persuadee (EE): No thank you
Persuader (ER): Do you have children yourself?
Persuader (ER): What if your children were in a position these kids are in, wouldn't you want someone to help them?
Persuadee (EE): Where are those childrens parent?
Persuader (ER): If only they had parental support, but in war-torn countries like Syria their parents are being killed in wars or are fighting for their country, they have no help and that's why they need your support, please find it in your heart to just give a little bit tonight, that's all I'm asking.
Persuadee (EE): My small change won't do a thing for those kids.

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hi there
Persuadee (EE): Hello
Persuader (ER): Have you heard of the Save the Children charity?
Persuadee (EE): I actually have not.
Persuadee (EE): What do they do to help children?
Persuader (ER): It is an international organization that helps protect and promote rights for childrens and provides for them in suffering conditions - such as lack of basic needs, like water, clothing, and food.
Persuadee (EE): I'm glad a charity like that exists internationally.
Persuader (ER): It's for a great cause.
Persuader (ER): Children are the future and unfortunately too many of them don't get the quality of life that we take advantage of today.
Persuader (ER): Sometimes we're in a better place and we have to do what we can to help their conditions a little bit.
Persuader (ER): Even little bits can go a long way, you know?
Persuadee (EE): it does, and charities can go further with the amount of money donated.
Persuader (ER): Absolutely.
Persuader (ER): I remember seeing ads on the television about it and it breaks my hear to see children so sad and suffering in conditions that they live in.
Persuader (ER): I haven't personally witnessed experiences first hand, however, it comes down to basic human needs.
Persuadee (EE): It's sad to think being born in the wrong conditions can have such a lifelong impact.
Persuader (ER): Exactly.
Persuader (ER): It's not like we really get the choice of how/when/where we are born.
Persuader (ER): It's a matter of chance.
Persuader (ER): It's unfair to be born into conditions like that.
Persuadee (EE): Hopefully, more the people born more lucky can lend a hand.
Persuader (ER): Absolutely!
Persuader (ER): Would you like to be able to assist some of these children by donating any amount of your choosing up to $2?
Persuader (ER): A little bit can go a long way!
Persuadee (EE): Yes, absolutely.
Persuadee (EE): I can donate $0.50.

Persuader (ER): We do whatever it takes for children ??Â¸??Â¸ transforming their lives and the future we share ??Â¸??Â¸ because we believe every child deserves a future.
Persuadee (EE): Where in the world are the children located?
Persuader (ER): US and global, wherever children need help, they are there.
Persuadee (EE): If I donate $25, does that go a long way?

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hello!

Persuader (ER): I think I need to actually start donating.
Persuader (ER): How does it make you feel?
Persuader (ER): Do you donate?
Persuadee (EE): I don't like to donate to for profit businesses.
Persuadee (EE): I feel like they'll just take my donation and get their tax credit.
Persuader (ER): How do you feel about Save the Children?
Persuader (ER): My nephew had to get taken into the hospital not too long ago and I just got the letter in the mail saying they used Save the Childrens donation money to help him.
Persuader (ER): I'm thinking about donating to them.
Persuadee (EE): I'm sorry to hear about your nephew?
Persuadee (EE): What happened, if you don't mind me asking.
Persuader (ER): We found out the hard way that he has actual celiacs (sorry I can't spell too well) and he has an allergic reaction to the cake on his birthday.
Persuader (ER): He went through a TON of testing and that's how they caught it.
Persuader (ER): He has to stay overnight at the hospital for a few weeks and his parents just couldn't afford it.
Persuader (ER): That's when Save the Children came around to help
Persuadee (EE): Oh my gosh.
Persuadee (EE): I am so sorry to hear about the little guy and how his birthday, too.
Persuadee (EE): How did Save the Children help?
Persuader (ER): They helped cover the bills for it since he's in Africa.
Persuader (ER): He's doing much better now though!
Persuadee (EE): Oh wow.
Persuadee (EE): All the way in Africa.
Persuadee (EE): I'm really glad to hear that.
Persuadee (EE): You must be so releived.
Persuader (ER): I am!
Persuader (ER): I'm thinking about donating to them would you be willing to help?
Persuadee (EE): Sure thing.
Persuadee (EE): What are the amounts I can pick from?
Persuader (ER): You can choose any amount from 0 to all of you payment
Persuadee (EE): I'll do $20.

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hello!
Persuadee (EE): Hey
Persuader (ER): So, are you interested in charities that help save the children?
Persuadee (EE): Which children?
Persuader (ER): What does the charity do exactly?
Persuader (ER): Instead of the typical charities that help children in a far away land, we here use state of the art location technology to help children in need right in your own community so you can see your money at work personally
Persuadee (EE): What would my money do exactly
Persuader (ER): It would go to the three most important things that a child need.
Persuader (ER): Food, shelter, and education.
Persuader (ER): The majority of your donation would go towards education as that is often the most difficult to provide for the children
Persuadee (EE): How would I know that the money is actually being used to help children and not just pocketed by the people that run the c harity
Persuader (ER): We are completely transparent with our records, when you donate you will be given an account so you can track where every bit of your money goes, from your account all the way to the community.
Persuadee (EE): Okay, that sounds reasonable
Persuader (ER): We appreciate your willingness to donate to this local cause, how much of a gratuity will you be offering today?
Persuadee (EE): I'll donate $10
Persuader (ER): Perfect, we will be sending over an email to setup your account info so you can track it and make any future donations if you desire.
Persuader (ER): Thank you and have a nice day

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hey there, glad we can talk tonight.
Persuadee (EE): Hello, same!
Persuader (ER): I'd like to talk to you about something that's very dear to me.
Persuader (ER): Do you have a moment?
Persuadee (EE): Yeah, totally.
Persuadee (EE): Go ahead
Persuader (ER): What was it like for you growing up?
Persuader (ER): Were your basic needs met like food, place to live, water, etc?
Persuadee (EE): Well, I grew up in a wealthy house.
Persuadee (EE): My mother and father both have a PhD so their jobs made possible for us to be able to cover all that and so much more
Persuader (ER): You are very lucky.
Persuader (ER): I wish all kids could have that kind of opportunity.
Persuadee (EE): So do I, I feel kind of guilty to being able to have all that and they are kids out there who don't have not a single one of all of those basic things
Persuader (ER): No need to feel guilty.
Persuader (ER): People don't have a choice of who or where they are born to.
Persuader (ER): Those of us who got lucky, can always lend a hand in our own ways.
Persuader (ER): What do you think?
Persuadee (EE): I totally agree, I think if you can, you should help others in need
Persuader (ER): I'd like to tell you about an organization called Save the Children.
Persuader (ER): Have you heard about them?
Persuadee (EE): Not really, please tell me anything!
Persuader (ER): They are an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
Persuadee (EE): Oh, that's totally awesome!
Persuadee (EE): Do you donate to this organization?

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hi there.
Persuader (ER): How are you today?
Persuadee (EE): Hello, I am fine, how about you?
Persuader (ER): Very well thanks.
Persuader (ER): Do you currently give any money to charity on a regular basis?
Persuadee (EE): Yes, I try to help time to time
Persuader (ER): Any charity in particular?
Persuadee (EE): No, anything that catches my eyes, or I find them on gofundme, what about you?
Persuader (ER): I have a few payments set up monthly.
Persuader (ER): I assume then you've heard of Save the Children and the great work they do with young people?
Persuadee (EE): Yes, I've heard of it.
Persuadee (EE): Can you please explain more about it?
Persuader (ER): Firstly, they provide funds and support services to help protect vulnerable children all over the world.
Persuader (ER): Once the children have a safe environment the next priority is to improve their lives via education and other resources.
Persuader (ER): They really make a difference to the lives of children in poverty or destitution.
Persuadee (EE): I am interested in it.
Persuadee (EE): I already checked their website.
Persuadee (EE): Health and education both are important factors
Persuader (ER): Absolutely.
Persuader (ER): And the great thing for us is that even a very small donation goes a long way due to the number of people who can donate!
Persuader (ER): We're asking people today to give a small part of the payment for this HIT to the charity.
Persuader (ER): You'll get a box pop up at teh end of our chat which will give you the opportunity to donate something.
Persuader (ER): Obviously the more the better, but I also appreciate that you aren't turking for free so you can judge it yourself.
Persuadee (EE): Actually I like these kind of HITs.
Persuadee (EE): I did few HITs before that asked me to donate my bonus or half of the reward.
Persuadee (EE): I happily did.
Persuadee (EE): I am sure there are people who need it more than me
Persuader (ER): You're absolutely right-  sometimes we don't realise it, but what seems like a little bit of moeny to us can make a big difference to them.
Persuader (ER): I worked in Africa earlier this year and the difference a few dollars can make to people over there is unbelievable.
Persuadee (EE): Yes, few dollars can save a child or can help a family to survive for a month.
Persuadee (EE): How long have you worked there?
Persuader (ER): I'm back in the UK now - I was in South Africa (Durban for three months from January to end of March) for work.
Persuadee (EE): That is so nice of you.
Persuadee (EE): It is a big thing to do.
Persuadee (EE): Thinking about starving children makes me so sad.
Persuadee (EE): I wish I could do more
Persuader (ER): We can all do something - donate a little bit or volunteer to try to help.

Persuadee (EE): I have not heard of Save the Children?

Persuader (ER): How did you get involved in an opportunity like that?

Persuadee (EE): There is quite a bit of training and background checks, but it's worth it!
Persuader (ER): I'd like to chat with you about a children's charity today.

Persuader (ER): Save the children is a good organization.

Persuader (ER): Things that are basic needs are given to them.
Persuadee (EE): I'm glad they do that but there are many charities that claim to do the same thing.

Persuader (ER): I hope you consider them and decide they are worthy

Persuader (ER): Hello, how much would you like to donate to the Save the Children charity today?

Persuader (ER): Did you know each dollar you donate will be doubled by the organization?
Persuadee (EE): I did not know that
Persuader (ER): Every day, 16,000 children die before their 5th birthday, mostly from preventable causes.
Persuader (ER): Were you aware of this fact?
Persuadee (EE): I was not aware of that fact, no.
Persuader (ER): Millions of children in the U.S. and around the world still aren't getting what they deserve.
Persuader (ER): We're talking about children in need.
Persuader (ER): Dying, when the world knows how to save them.
Persuader (ER): Vulnerable children in poverty.
Persuader (ER): Denied an education.
Persuader (ER): Forced to flee violence.
Persuader (ER): Orphaned, abused, abandoned.
Persuader (ER): Children with no reason to smile.
Persuader (ER): No hope for the future.
Persuader (ER): The world's children deserve better and you're making a difference.

Persuader (ER): Then ask yourself how much of that could have saved a life.

Persuadee (EE): I'm guessing a lot more than me.

Persuader (ER): Through our education, protection and emergency programs, we reached 638,000 kids in 2016 alone.
Persuader (ER): May I confirm our donation agreement is in fact $10 ?
Persuadee (EE): It is in fact 10 or 5% of my weekly income.
Persuadee (EE): can I confirm that you would also like to donate 5% of yours?

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hey!

Persuader (ER): The money is truly going to the children, as opposed to the company

Persuader (ER): Hello.

Persuader (ER): That means more than 9.1 million people die of hunger every year.

Persuader (ER): It makes me angry to know of so many children in danger in the world.

Persuadee (EE): Especially those who are very wealthy themselves and don't care to make a difference
Persuader (ER): I agree!
Persuader (ER): I certainly am not wealthy but still try to make donation as often as I can.

Persuader (ER): So we don't even need to use Paypal.

Persuader (ER): Ok great!
Persuader (ER): I think we are really part of the solution this way.

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Have you thought about how much of the reward for this HIT you want to donate to Save the Children?
Persuadee (EE): I do not want to donate any of my reward for this hit.
Persuadee (EE): I make donations to charity regularly but not from jobs that I do.
Persuader (ER): Save the Children is a great international no-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
Persuader (ER): It has a very low overhead and almost all the money donated to it is directly used to help children.
Persuadee (EE): I know that it is a good organization and I support them.
Persuadee (EE): However I am not getting a reward from this hit.
Persuadee (EE): I am spending my time completing it so I am being paid for a job.
Persuadee (EE): I want the money to do with as I choose.
Persuader (ER): Save the Children has helped build hundreds of schools in developing nations around the world.
Persuader (ER): They've educated many children who have gone on to do important medical and other life saving jobs.
Persuadee (EE): I still do not want to make a donation from this money.
Persuader (ER): Another example is in Syria over 1,000 children have already been killed this year!
Persuader (ER): Save the Children is helping to evacuate as many children as possible from that country.
Persuader (ER): Don't you think every child deserves a long and happy life?
Persuadee (EE): Yes I do think that they do.
Persuader (ER): Don't you want to be part of the solution by giving as much money as possible to Save the Children so they can help as many children as possible?
Persuadee (EE): I do not want to make a donation today.

Persuadee (EE): We work for everything that we have.

Persuader (ER): Of course you work for everything you own.
Persuader (ER): By helping Save the Children you will directly be allowing a child to grow up and work for things him or herself rather than living in poverty and possibly not even making it out of childhood.

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hi there.
Persuader (ER): Have you ever thought about who the most vulnerable people are when a natural disaster strikes?
Persuader (ER): Or when there's political unrest?
Persuadee (EE): That is something I do not think about.
Persuader (ER): Actually, I'm really troubled by the answer.
Persuader (ER): In countries like Syria, 1000 children have been killed during the civil war.
Persuader (ER): Isn't that insane?
Persuadee (EE): That is terrible.
Persuadee (EE): I wish this wasn't true.
Persuader (ER): Seriously.
Persuader (ER): Adults often can't fend for themselves when there's a crisis, but children are especially vulnerable.
Persuader (ER): Do you think that if you could do something to help Syrian children or children in Indonesia, which just experienced an earthquake, you would?.
Persuadee (EE): That would be something I would do, yes.
Persuader (ER): Yeah, me too.
Persuader (ER): Every day I watch the news and hear about victims all over the world and feel kind of powerless.
Persuadee (EE): You have more power than you realize.
Persuader (ER): Can you elaborate.
Persuader (ER): How do you think people like us could help?
Persuadee (EE): We could either donate money or our time.
Persuader (ER): Absolutely.
Persuader (ER): There are so many charities out there but I\'ve been researching one in particular called "Save the Children."
Persuader (ER): All of the money they collect goes straight to helping children in war torn parts of the world and places that have suffered natural disasters.
Persuadee (EE): I will have to take a look at the website.
Persuader (ER): Is there any information that I could provide you with.
Persuader (ER): I really believe in this organization and think it's worthwhile.
Persuadee (EE): How long has the organization been around?
Persuader (ER): It's actually been around since 1919, when it was founded by this woman in London right after World War I
Persuadee (EE): What is the womens name that founded it?

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Save the Children is a great organization that looks out for the well being of children in need.
Persuader (ER): Currently they are looking for individuals to help their cause.
Persuadee (EE): where is this organization based?
Persuadee (EE): Do they help children from a particular country or is it all around the world?
Persuader (ER): They help children mostly in developing countries around the world.
Persuader (ER): Think about all the stories you hear in the news and on social media about children that need help or have been taken advantage of.
Persuadee (EE): Yeah stories like that are very heart breaking.
Persuadee (EE): What types of programs do they offer?
Persuadee (EE): Like do they just supply food?
Persuader (ER): They often protect children from being victims of hunger, violence, and child labor.
Persuader (ER): They also advocate for schooling and provide opportunities for families to get ahead.
Persuader (ER): It is a great social cause that is worth donating to!
Persuadee (EE): That sound great but you know my biggest concern with making donations to charities is always the question of just how much of the money I give actually reaches to the intended people.
Persuader (ER): Save the Children is a very well known, credible organization with transparency.
Persuader (ER): Visiting the organization's website allows you to understand how even a small donation can have an impact.
Persuadee (EE): Oh I see so they have a website that I could learn more about them.
Persuader (ER): Think about how much money you spend on non essentials in your life.
Persuader (ER): Now think about sacrificing just one of those to help out a child.
Persuadee (EE): Yeah I think its good to help any little bit you can.
Persuadee (EE): How much is the typical donation amount usually?
Persuader (ER): It all depends on what you are comfortable with.
Persuader (ER): Every bit helps.
Persuader (ER): But one thing is for certain, you will feel good about your donation!
Persuadee (EE): So after making a donation, I won't exactly see how the money I give will be used right?
Persuadee (EE): I mean this is not like sponsoring a child or family situation right?
Persuader (ER): You will not see how it directly impacts one child, but instead think about focusing on how your donation would impact multiple children and families!
Persuadee (EE): Yes that is true.
Persuadee (EE): Have you made a donation to this organization before?
Persuader (ER): I try to donate a couple of times per year, especially around the holidays.
Persuader (ER): I have felt great in the past about this and will continue in the future.
Persuader (ER): You will instantly feel better about your decision once you do.

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hi, how are you today?
Persuadee (EE): okay..and how are you
Persuader (ER): I'm doing great.
Persuader (ER): Out of curiousity, have you heard of the organization Save the Children?
Persuadee (EE): yes..i am very familiar..
Persuadee (EE): are you involved with charity
Persuader (ER): Yes!
Persuader (ER): I really prefer local charities but some nationwide and international ones are very dear to my heart.
Persuader (ER): Whenever we have the opportunity to donate from our task rewards I always try to give a little bit.
Persuadee (EE): me too..i see many commercials for charity on TV and it breaks my heart..
Persuadee (EE): i am also a follower of Unicef, are you familiar
Persuader (ER): Yes, I've heard of Unicef.
Persuader (ER): Another great organization.
Persuader (ER): One thing I love about Save the Children is that they have very high ratings from third-party reportings.
Persuader (ER): I know when I donate to them that my money is being used wisely!
Persuadee (EE): interesting, what do the ratings represent
Persuader (ER): The ratings are from different companies such as Better Business Bureau and American Institute of Philanthropy.
Persuader (ER): They actually get the financial reports from the IRS to confirm the accuracy in where the funds are going.
Persuadee (EE): very good...are you interested in other charities involved with children
Persuader (ER): I have given to other organizations in the past, such as World Vision, but Save the Children is really important to me right now.
Persuader (ER): There is such a lack of support right now in developing countries, and Save the Children really focuses on that.
Persuadee (EE): i happen to favor unicef since my kids collect for halloween and kids count monies as part of class project.
Persuader (ER): I totally understand that.
Persuader (ER): One thing I like about Save the Children is that it isn't just global but also focuses on kids in need here in the USA, especially the poverty-torn cities.
Persuadee (EE): i tend to give up to 100$ a month to children's org- what is your prefered donation?
Persuader (ER): I typically give less than that, because I also give to my local church and other local organizations in my city.
Persuadee (EE): ah..what do you consider a fair donation per month
Persuader (ER): Well, I just usually give $20 or $30 to a handful of charities that I love.
Persuader (ER): But like I said, if the opportunity arises for me to donate some of my HIT reward to a charity, I will usually donate at least a small portion.
Persuader (ER): Do you ever do that?

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hello, are you interested in protection of rights of children?
Persuadee (EE): Yes, definitely.

Persuader (ER): There is organisation called Save the Children and donations are essential to ensure children's rights to health,education and safety.

Persuader (ER): Here is their website, URL
Persuader (ER): They help children all around the world.
Persuader (ER): For instance, millions of Syrian children have grown up facing the daily threat of violence.
Persuader (ER): In the first two months of 2018 alone, 1,000 children were reportedly killed or injured in intensifying violence.
Persuadee (EE): I can't imagine how terrible it must be for a child to grow up inside a war zone.
Persuader (ER): As you mentioned,this organisation has different programs,and one of them is to "sponsor" child.
Persuader (ER): You choose the location.
Persuadee (EE): Are you connected with the NGO yourself?
Persuader (ER): No,but i want to donate some amount from this survey.
Persuader (ER): Research team will send money to this organisation.
Persuadee (EE): That sounds great.
Persuadee (EE): Does it come from our reward/bonuses?
Persuader (ER): Yes,the amount you want to donate is deducted from your reward.
Persuadee (EE): What do you have in mind?
Persuader (ER): I know that my small donation is not enough,so i am asking you to also donate some small percentage from reward.
Persuadee (EE): I am willing to match your donation.
Persuader (ER): Cool,the reward for this task is 0.30$ so i am  thinking about donating like 0.15$

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hello how are  you doing today?
Persuadee (EE): I'm good, how are you?
Persuader (ER): I am well.
Persuader (ER): Just enjoying the sunny day and trying to help out a charity I am working on, Save the Children.
Persuadee (EE): I wish I had some sun.
Persuadee (EE): Please tell me more about this charity
Persuader (ER): This charity is n international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
Persuader (ER): I have recently donated some money to it.
Persuader (ER): Would you be interested in how much I donated?
Persuadee (EE): Yes please.
Persuadee (EE): And also, was the donation mandatory or voluntary?
Persuader (ER): I donate about $15 a month and it is all voluntary.
Persuader (ER): I rather put my money into this charity then church offering because I know it directly helps children.
Persuader (ER): Would you like to know how I know it helps?
Persuadee (EE): That sounds like a reasonable amount.
Persuadee (EE): Sure, tell me more about how it's used
Persuader (ER): A year ago, I saw kid begging on the street who look really hungry.
Persuader (ER): I was about to give him some money until a representative for "Save the Children" walked ahead of me and help this kid out.
Persuader (ER): This person took them to their facility and provided food, shelter, and clothing.
Persuader (ER): A month later I saw the kid was healthier, happy, and cleaner.
Persuader (ER): I was so impress I decided to make a donation.
Persuader (ER): Would you be interested in a donation?
Persuadee (EE): Wow.
Persuadee (EE): Nice story.
Persuadee (EE): I'm very particular about who I donate to so I'd need more information
Persuader (ER): Understand.
Persuadee (EE): About how many people a month does the charity help?
Persuader (ER): Since it is international it helps more then 1000's of kids per month.
Persuadee (EE): And is there a minimum amount required per month (like on of those sponsor a kid charities) or can it be just a one time donation?
Persuader (ER): No minimum, can be a one time donation.

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hi, I hope you are well today!
Persuadee (EE): I am how are you doing?
Persuader (ER): Great!
Persuader (ER): I'm getting ready to spend the day volunteering for my favorite charity!
Persuadee (EE): Yes, so I think it is a good idea to donate to the childrens charity.
Persuader (ER): Same here!
Persuader (ER): I am volunteering for the charity called Save the Children.
Persuader (ER): Are you familiar with them?
Persuadee (EE): No I am not.
Persuadee (EE): Can you tell me about it?
Persuader (ER): They promote children's rights and help support kids in developing countries.
Persuader (ER): It takes so little money to help feed a starving child.
Persuadee (EE): What can I do to help?
Persuader (ER): I'm so glad you asked!
Persuader (ER): One thing you could do is agree to contribute what you make just from this one task we are doing right now.
Persuadee (EE): Ok how much do you need?
Persuader (ER): If you pledge to contribute the reward from this task, that will feed a starving child for a full day!
Persuader (ER): Isn't that amazing?
Persuadee (EE): That is awesome but I need the money so I can't afford to give right now.
Persuader (ER): I know what you mean, I need to make money too.
Persuader (ER): But at the same time, here we are in front of our computers, and we can work all day to make up the small amount we will contribute.
Persuadee (EE): I can't work all day.
Persuadee (EE): I have to take care of my disable family member and I really can't afford it.
Persuader (ER): Oh I'm so sorry to hear that.
Persuader (ER): I have problems too.
Persuader (ER): But as little as $1 can feed a child for the whole day.
Persuader (ER): I don't know about you, but I could find $1 in change just lying around the house.
Persuader (ER): No matter how big our problems are, we are not going to starve for lack of a dollar...
Persuadee (EE): I have 10 cents I can give.
Persuader (ER): That's awesome and generous!

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hello, I would like to ask you to consider making a donation to Save the Children, an international NGO committed to promoting children's rights, and providing support for children in developing countries.
Persuadee (EE): ohh how much donation would yoy expect?
Persuader (ER): Your donation can be from $0 to all of the payment for this task.
Persuader (ER): But before you decide hastily, I would like to remind you that Save the Children is one of the only charities doing what it does.
Persuader (ER): There are children out there now without access to housing, clean water, education, and many other things we often take for granted.
Persuader (ER): So please, consider thoughtfully whether you would be willing to make a sacrifice for the children of the world.
Persuadee (EE): how do i trust the organiation?
Persuader (ER): Save the Children is a world-renowned NGO with a trusted history and background.
Persuader (ER): You can read about their successes on their website:   URL
Persuader (ER): Also, they have been given high ratings from different charity watchodgs.
Persuadee (EE): okay i will check it.. by the way how much did you donate?
Persuader (ER): I donated $2, which is the maximum payment.
Persuader (ER): I understand that everyone cannot commit to making a serious donation, but when we think about children suffering, we have a moral imperative to act in their defense.
Persuadee (EE): okay i will donate $1
Persuader (ER): If it's not too much to ask, I would like you to consider donating perhaps more.
Persuader (ER): After all, there are children in Syria now growing up facing threats of violence everyday.
Persuader (ER): Surely an additional dollar, which we might spend on a cup of coffee or a bag of chips, could more greatly aid them then us.
Persuadee (EE): no i am okay with this amount
Persuader (ER): OK, I will not force you to make a decision you don't want to.
Persuader (ER): I will just ask you to consider how you would feel if your child was danger like many children are.
Persuadee (EE): actually i am not donating like this.. if i would like to donate money i will give food and clothes to the kids directly
Persuader (ER): While that is possible in a local community, it fails to take into account the suffering of kids in developing countries around the world, a specialty of Save the Children.
Persuader (ER): Save the Children maximizes the efficiency of donations so that every dollar makes a difference.
Persuader (ER): Are you sure you don't want to reconsider?
Persuadee (EE): yes i am very much sure.

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hello
Persuadee (EE): Hi.
Persuadee (EE): I really do not know much about children's charity, do you?
Persuader (ER): Oh.
Persuader (ER): There is this children's charity my friend volunteers for.
Persuader (ER): It's called Save the Children.
Persuader (ER): Have you heard of it?
Persuadee (EE): I think so.
Persuadee (EE): Does it have commercials on tv?
Persuader (ER): Yes, they do.
Persuader (ER): I wish they didn't have to spend their monies on commericals but it is the only way to get their name out there.
Persuadee (EE): Does this charity help children in the United States, or do they deal mostly with children in African nations?
Persuader (ER): It is a global charity.
Persuader (ER): They help out children in the US and around the world.
Persuader (ER): You should check out their website:  URL s/what-we-do/us-programs
Persuadee (EE): I will copy and save the website address.
Persuadee (EE): What do volunteers do for this charity?
Persuadee (EE): I ask that because volunteering would be easier for me than sending money.
Persuader (ER): My friend is a nurse and she takes a month off every year to go to Africa to help out.
Persuader (ER): I would love to do that but can't possibly get that much time off.
Persuader (ER): How about you?
Persuadee (EE): That is awesome that your friend does that!
Persuadee (EE): I'm not a nurse though, and couldn't possibly travel to Africa or anywhere else.
Persuader (ER): Well, the next best thing is to donate.
Persuader (ER): You don't have to give much.
Persuader (ER): A few cents a month is all it takes to help change a child's life.
Persuader (ER): Would you be willing to donate?
Persuadee (EE): No, I honestly don't have any money.
Persuadee (EE): If I did have extra money, I would probably donate to St Jude's.
Persuadee (EE): I have given a few extra cents sometimes at the checkout in grocery stores.
Persuader (ER): I know money is tight.
Persuader (ER): It sure is for me too.
Persuader (ER): I only ask you to think about whether you buy any unnecessary things like a starbucks coffee every day.
Persuader (ER): I know there are often times I regret spending money on that when there are starving kids in the world that could be helped.
Persuader (ER): Do you ever feel that way?

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Hello.
Persuadee (EE): Hello!
Persuader (ER): I am supposed to ask you if you care about people being killed in Syria and things like that, I don't want to cause you any emotional discomfort by talking about suffering people.

Persuader (ER): To talk about suffering people and children for a minute?
Persuadee (EE): I will have no discomfort discussing suffering people.
Persuader (ER): I think the refugee crisis is crazy, I am not sure what I would do if I was raising my kids in Syria.
Persuader (ER): If anyone could have fun in those spots it's kids though.
Persuadee (EE): I feel really torn about the crisis.
Persuadee (EE): I don't think the weight of that burden should fall on the rest of the worlds shoulders.
Persuadee (EE): At the same time as a parent I would want the best possible future for my children and I know fiercly that I would do everything in my power to make sure they were in a safe place.
Persuader (ER): I actually didn't think of it like that.
Persuader (ER): I am a parent too, it feels so foreign what they are going through.
Persuader (ER): This whole chat thing is supposed to get me to get you to donate to Save the Children, but now I think they got me to do it instead!
Persuader (ER): I don't know if that's really okay to do though.
Persuadee (EE): I always wonder how much of donations actually go where ear marked.
Persuadee (EE): I see on the local level how much of donations stay local and what gets spent on things I would call "stupid".
Persuadee (EE): I am always worried if I donate it will just go to some higer up that is living the high life.
Persuadee (EE): Sorry Im getting off topic.
Persuader (ER): No, that's relevant.
Persuader (ER): Really relevant.
Persuader (ER): It's really easy to get cynical about life and if people really benefit from any of this.
Persuader (ER): I usually donate in hopes I can at least feel like I did my part.
Persuader (ER): If I donated and some corrupt person took it, that's the worst karma and even worst scandal imaginable.
Persuader (ER): The people who donate and people who are worrying about that are the same people.
Persuader (ER): You're not a horrible person it sounds like, just worried if what you do even matters.
Persuadee (EE): With that all said I do feel like any orginazation that aims to help the children I am more inclined to donate to them than most.
Persuadee (EE): My boss has a sponsored child that she sends money to every month.
Persuadee (EE): SHe picked out a child with the same birth month as one of her kids.
Persuadee (EE): I think helping children is an important thing as they are our future!
Persuader (ER): I feel like you are smart enough and definitely moral enough to be the boss.
Persuader (ER): I hope you have success  in your field.
Persuader (ER): I don't have that great of a job or boss but I'd still  I would like to match a donation with you if you're willing to try help kids with me.
Persuader (ER): I am parent and I feel like I need extra help sometimes too , but knowing that I could REALLY help them makes feel like a better parent.
Persuadee (EE): I think donating to this cause would def be a step in the right direction to hopefully helping across the world the children that are in dispair.
Persuadee (EE): They are the weak ones in my eyes.
Persuader (ER): I don't want you to donate any more than you want, so if you want to donate how much do you to do?
Persuader (ER): I think any amount you give (especially more) will definitely help and I want you to know that it would be deducted from you task payment.
Persuader (ER): Whatever you choose to do or the amount you want to give, I feel like you've changed my mind about charity, not the other way around, so I want to thank you for that.
Persuadee (EE): I think its just the perspective of the person but we all inheriently want to help as much as we can.
Persuadee (EE): I would donate half of this hit payment to this charity and feel good about it I think.

conversation:
Persuader (ER): Have you ever heard of "Save the Children"?
Persuader (ER): It an agency that helps children in underdeveloped and developing countries.
Persuadee (EE): No, I actually haven't .
Persuadee (EE): Do you have any more information about the organization that you could tell me?
Persuader (ER): it is not sponsored or supported by any governmental agencies and it helps children abroad and within the US.
Persuader (ER): You would be shocked at how many children live in poverty here in the United States.
Persuadee (EE): I have an idea.
Persuadee (EE): Whats a more specific idea of what you do?
Persuadee (EE): How do you help?
Persuadee (EE): Whats their overall goal?
Persuader (ER): Well, a very specific goal right is to help the children that are separated from their parents due to our current immigration problem.
Persuader (ER): Can you imagine someone taking your small child away from you and not knowing where they are going, who is going to be caring for them, or if you will ever be able to see them again?
Persuader (ER): As a mother, that thought is horrifying.
Persuadee (EE): It is horrifying, I could not even imagine.
Persuadee (EE): What do you need me to do?
Persuader (ER): Save the Children has committed to providing some of the care and needs for these children until they can be reunited with their parents.
Persuader (ER): Would you be willing to donate your pay for this task to Save the Children so they can continue to provide care for these misplaced children?
Persuadee (EE): My pay?
Persuadee (EE): As in my weekly paycheck?
Persuadee (EE): Or are there any other payment options, as I have bills to pay.
Persuader (ER): No, but you could donate part of your pay for this particular task here.
Persuader (ER): Say, maybe half of your payment for this task or even the whole thing?
Persuadee (EE): I will happily donate my whole payment for this task. :)
Persuader (ER): Thank you!
Persuader (ER): Save the Children is a very reputable charity and your donation will mean so much!
Persuadee (EE): I am so grateful there is a way for me to help financially!!!
